item.title: How to get Map ID
item.dc:creator: @CoderOops CoderOops
item.description:
@CoderOops wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:524058”][quote author=CoderOops link=topic=642604.msg4327389#msg4327389 date=1373162615]

This sounds like it should be in client help.

Dunno where it belongs… Lost sheep ya know… Because I’m asking for command(?)
Just need to know that ID and it is done. Command to do it would be awesome, but other ways are good also:)…

Regardless of what you’re asking for, it needs to go into the right section.
by the way, client sided commands are name specific.
So in order to use this command, you’d literally type:
getmapid
and then hit enter.
if you want it to be] ::getmapid
then change it to ("::getmapid")
also, your command doesn’t have more than one args, and isn’t going to be split. You should use:
aString887.equalsIgnoreCase
instead of:
aString887.startsWith

I’m asking for way to find out ID of the map. (Map = Arena where you can move without loading another square map)
[/quote]
I understand that, but you said it wasn’t working.
I figured it may have been user error.[/quote]

GetMapId.java:1: error: class, interface, or enum expected if(playerCommand.startsWith("getmapid")) { ^ GetMapId.java:2: error: class, interface, or enum expected for(int k12 = 0; k12 < anIntArray1234.length; k1 2++) ^ GetMapId.java:2: error: class, interface, or enum expected for(int k12 = 0; k12 < anIntArray1234.length; k1 2++) ^ GetMapId.java:4: error: class, interface, or enum expected for(int k12 = 0; k12 < anIntArray1234.length; k1 2++) ^ GetMapId.java:4: error: class, interface, or enum expected for(int k12 = 0; k12 < anIntArray1234.length; k1 2++) ^ GetMapId.java:4: error: class, interface, or enum expected for(int k12 = 0; k12 < anIntArray1234.length; k1 2++) ^ GetMapId.java:6: error: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ 7 errors Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

This sounds like it should be in client help.

Dunno where it belongs… Lost sheep ya know… Because I’m asking for command(?)
Just need to know that ID and it is done. Command to do it would be awesome, but other ways are good also:)…

Regardless of what you’re asking for, it needs to go into the right section.
by the way, client sided commands are name specific.
So in order to use this command, you’d literally type:
getmapid
and then hit enter.
if you want it to be] ::getmapid
then change it to ("::getmapid")
also, your command doesn’t have more than one args, and isn’t going to be split. You should use:
aString887.equalsIgnoreCase
instead of:
aString887.startsWith
[/quote]

I’m asking for way to find out ID of the map. (Map = Arena where you can move without loading another square map)[/quote]
I understand that, but you said it wasn’t working.
I figured it may have been user error.

This sounds like it should be in client help.

Dunno where it belongs… Lost sheep ya know… Because I’m asking for command(?)
Just need to know that ID and it is done. Command to do it would be awesome, but other ways are good also:)…
[/quote]
Regardless of what you’re asking for, it needs to go into the right section.
by the way, client sided commands are name specific.
So in order to use this command, you’d literally type:
getmapid
and then hit enter.
if you want it to be] ::getmapid
then change it to ("::getmapid")
also, your command doesn’t have more than one args, and isn’t going to be split. You should use:
aString887.equalsIgnoreCase
instead of:
aString887.startsWith[/quote]

I’m asking for way to find out ID of the map. (Map = Arena where you can move without loading another square map)

Dunno where it belongs… Lost sheep ya know… Because I’m asking for command(?)
Just need to know that ID and it is done. Command to do it would be awesome, but other ways are good also:)…[/quote]
Regardless of what you’re asking for, it needs to go into the right section.
by the way, client sided commands are name specific.
So in order to use this command, you’d literally type:
getmapid
and then hit enter.
if you want it to be] ::getmapid
then change it to ("::getmapid")
also, your command doesn’t have more than one args, and isn’t going to be split. You should use:
aString887.equalsIgnoreCase
instead of:
aString887.startsWith

item.title: How to get Map ID
item.dc:creator: @CoderOops CoderOops
item.description:
@CoderOops wrote:

Yo.
I have wondering around google feat. Staff, which every real wonderer do have, and been searching for answer, but haven’t found anything.

How do I get know Map ID of the Map where I’m standing on?

This info is needed for Custom maps and I have some ready.

EDIT:
I found 1 to use, but for some reason it does not work:

This is command to use inGame, which should tell me ID of map I’m on.

if(aString887.startsWith("getmapid")) { for(int k12 = 0; k12 < anIntArray1234.length; k12++) method77("Current Floormaps: "+anIntArray1235[k12]+"", 0, "", aBoolean991); for(int k12 = 0; k12 < anIntArray1234.length; k12++) method77("Current objectmaps: "+anIntArray1236[k12]+"", 0, "", aBoolean991);

Read full topic
